title: Rewrite run_test.sh in Python
body_html:
I spent a little time last night rewriting run_test.sh in Python, in a way that allows more flexibility for which tests are run. The script now allows general set operations on tests: including tests, excluding tests, including only a range of tests (with a first and last). I need this for importing PyTorch into our codebase.

Examples:

  • run_test.py --include torch nn cpp_extensions
  • run_test.py --exclude jit
  • run_test.py --first jit (ever failed a test in the middle of run_test.sh and wanted to restart from there?)

I've rewritten as much logic as possible in Python, except for the distributed tests because they setup traps and have a lot of system interaction -- it's easier to just call a shell script in that case.

This script should also be more cross-platform and can be run on posix and windows.

@ezyang and @apaszke, let me know your thoughts.
